poem:
**Snocaps in Harmony**

Twinned roots,  
Katie and Allison—  
echoes of PS Eliot  
in tender Americana.  
Guitars like gentle rivers,  
undying chords,  
Brad's whispers  
in the mix,  
their pact renewed,  
like autumn leaves igniting  
under new skies.  
In the shadow of snocaps,  
soft resilience  
sings the old,  
claims the new.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Snocaps: Snocaps review – Katie and Allison Crutchfield reunite with a little help from MJ Lenderman Snocaps sound exactly like the sum of their parts. A new band for fans of headstrong, tender Americana, Alabama twins Katie and Allison Crutchfield (of Waxahatchee and Swearin’ respectively) are in a new band together for the first time since scrappy, beloved PS Eliot retired in 2011. Backed by indie guitar star MJ Lenderman and storied alt-rock producer Brad". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
